intro: Stylagrostis ovata, commonly known as the white-flowered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are small, white, and arranged in clusters, while its leaves are pinnately divided. Stylagrostis ovata is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its hardy nature and aesthetic appeal.
